data.description:
Keep Your Child Safe from Internet Predators

Today's Fayetteville Observer story about a student teacher accused of having sexually explicit conversations with a 12-year-old boy is a good reminder to parents to keep an eye on their children’s social media activities: 
 
http://www.fayobserver.com/news/20180404/campbell-university-education-major-charged-with-sexting-12-year-old-boy 
  
Here are a few tips:
• Set reasonable rules and guidelines for computer, tablet and cell phone use by your children.
• Know the internet and any apps your child might use.
• Know your child’s user names and passwords and periodically check to see who they are communicating with.
• Keep the computer in a family room rather than the child’s bedroom.
• Never allow a child to arrange a face-to-face meeting on the internet without your knowledge.
• Teach children from an early age not to talk to strangers, even those who try to talk to them online. 
• Keep the lines of communication open with your children so they are comfortable confiding in you.
